editorialSummary.text: Louisiana-inspired fast-food chain known for its spicy fried chicken, biscuits & sides.

originalText.text: Yesterday I went into this  Popeyes location on my lunch break . I was not greeted when I walked in . The lady at the counter had an attitude as if I was bothering her . I ordered a chicken sandwich meal . I asked for a ranch sauce she told me she doesnâ€™t have any . Then sheâ€™s going to say I have to pay extra for a sauce.Food was cold , mind you it was only 11:30 am how is the food cold . Horrible customer service. I would definitely like a refund for my food .

originalText.text: Mac and cheese cup was $6 and filled just over halfway, super greasy and cold. The chicken was cold. The staff member didnâ€™t include my french fries and the biscuit was cold too. $17 for a barely edible meal.

originalText.text: As i placed this order a customer came in the restaurant with an order he had already purchased , he said they gave him items that wasn't what he wanted which was an order of 2 pieces of chicken and another order of 3 pieces of chicken , he told them he only wanted 3 pieces of chicken not the other 2 pieces of chicken , a worker from popeye returned him the money , and the chicken the customer brought back to Popeyes the worker from popeyes put it back on the shelf to resell it ! I kept an eye on that and that same chicken the customer returned! The worker of Popeyes ,  added that same chicken to my order ! and i said I don't want that chicken ! That the chicken the customer Brought back to Popeyes  the workers from Popeyes was supposed to throw it away in the garbage and not resell it because no one knows if that man did something bad to that chicken because he had taken it home then came back with it ! Instead of throwing that chicken away he took it to where the man in the back is frying chicken ! And in there language they said something and started laughing and couple of minutes later gave me my order and again spoke in there language laughing with one another ! Be really careful eating at this popeyes

originalText.text: The Popeyes in Washington Heights must be one of the worst fast-food locations in my area. I ordered a fish sandwich to go, the staff gave me my order, went home, started eating my sandwich, and it was CHICKEN! I was provided with was wrapped in a fish sandwich foil. I called the manager, was not sympathetic, then offered me an extra sandwich for the mistake. I went back to the store; as soon I entered, the front cashier spotted me and made a side comment to her colleague, and they both started laughing. I don't know why this was funny. If they are young and immature, I can understand, but the monitoring of staff must increase in the store. I finally received my sandwich 12 minutes later and return home to see my sandwich had two buns with tartar sauce in between the buns. What type of quality monitoring and control is happening? I called the manager, and she was not even ashamed. I have to tell her that I was calling the regional manager, and she started saying, sorry, please don't call. Unacceptable!
